result.execSummary:
The defendant Farron R. Dignin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Farron R. Dignin
parties.address: 210 E Division Street Apt 22, Neillsville, WI 54456

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. 15CM97, Count 1 Criminal Damage 943.01(1), count 2 Disorderly conduct 947.01(1) were dismissed and read-in to this case.
Concurrent with: Probation on Counts 1&2 of this case to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

DEFENDANT TO RECEIVE CREDIT FOR 27 DAYS SERVED IF REVOKED
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

Probation on counts 1&3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof-SEE COUNT 1 FOR CONDITIONS

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Farron R. Dignin, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Agreement reached.

Pre-trial conference at 07-07-2015 11:00 am.
Status conference at 07-16-2015 02:00 pm.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY

The defendant shall have no contact with M.R.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:40 am.
